hehe I agree with ieeni, it's a rough ride at times. I've doubted my sanity on more than one occasion, in particular before my wife knew she had OCD. (she just had her reality and I had mine, they clashed a lot, cue the fireworks)

Thank you for your help.  Good thing that I was born with lots of patience.  I understand the disorder much better after talking to several people.  I don't try to take control of him or the situation cause that causes strife and he gets defensive.  I just let him clean up the messes and put things in an orderly fashion the way he likes them to be.  And I thank him for being so tidy cause I can be a real slob.  I always try to make a positive out of a negative and it usually works for us.

question: Ok so I am in a relationship with a man who has OCD.  He is very loving and kind but can also be jealous and angry.  He eats alot of sweets and I wonder if he also has diabetes or some kind of bi polar disorder.  I am putting alot of energy into this relationship because we love each other very much but is this supposed to be this hard?  I mean loving a man with OCD and other issues, (especially abandonment).
title: Is this supposed to be difficult?
